tool_description: Stress-Test Your Application Resilience with the Broken API – Simulating Timeouts, Wrong Status Codes, and More.
name: Broken API
title: Broken API

api_list.name: /status-code/{code}
api_list.description: Request a specific status code to be returned
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://broken-api.p.rapidapi.com/status-code/202"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "broken-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

url = "https://broken-api.p.rapidapi.com/status-code/{code}"

api_list.name: /broken/{what_should_break}
api_list.description: Test against a specific broken event

api_list.name: /timeout/{time}
api_list.description: Request a specific time to be waited before responding

required_parameters.name: time
required_parameters.description: time in ms to be waited before responding

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://broken-api.p.rapidapi.com/timeout/40"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "broken-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
